_header: O ye masters and householders all
_description: Verses urging masters to give more work to servants and to inspire awe in them — one quatrain (abab) and concluding couplet

HarTYP193.Transcription:
O ye masters and howse houlders allThat hath sauruantes vnder your
                    curePut them labour what so ever befallAnd let the younge folcke of aw
                    be mureGod gyd me rightthat [on?] I myght
HarTYP193.Note:
Added to end flyleaf by later hand; headed, ‘Iesus
                    Christus’; concludes with name of scribe/author: ‘nouerint universi
                    per presentes me Iohanni morgin de vley in comitatis willelmi merser’ (f.
                    190)
